data.title: History: delete entries that are deleted or moved on disk
data.body: A regression from some work in October, this used to work.

data.title: Moving extension editor to another group makes details lost
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:27:10.246Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: DmitryDorofeev.empty-indent-0.1.2, MattiasPernhult.vscode-todo-0.8.0, SirTori.indenticator-0.2.1, Tyriar.lorem-ipsum, Tyriar.sort-lines-1.1.0, dbaeumer.jshint-0.10.15, dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.0.8, donjayamanne.python-0.4.2, eg2.tslint-0.5.39, gerane.Theme-BetterJS-0.0.3, gerane.Theme-ChromeDevTools-0.0.2, gerane.Theme-Github-0.0.2, gerane.Theme-HotDogStand-0.0.2, gerane.Theme-Hyrule-0.0.2, gerane.Theme-TomorrowNightEighties-0.0.2, jakob101.RelativePath-0.11.0, jmallien.ReplaceWithNewline-0.0.1, johnpapa.Angular2-1.0.2, jpalioto.StretchTimer, mrmlnc.vscode-apache-1.1.0, msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-1.2.2, nwallace.language-vscode-javascript-angular2-0.0.11, shyykoserhiy.vscode-spotify-1.0.0, stkb.rewrap-0.6.2, wmaurer.join-lines

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open Visual Studio Code.
2. `Preferences > Open User Settings` to open `Default Settings` and `settings.json` side-by-side.
3. `Extensions > Show Installed Extensions` to open the Extensions sidebar.
4. Click on an extension's title to open a description tab on the right.
5. With the `Default Settings` (left) tab in focus, hit <kbd>⌘</kbd> + <kbd>K</kbd> + <kbd>→</kbd> to swap left and right panes.

Expected result:

1. The `Extension:` tab switches sides with no change to its appearance.
2. The user may close all settings tabs and re-open them (i.e., <kbd>⌘</kbd> + <kbd>,</kbd>).

Actual result:

1. Inside the `Extension:` tab, contents of the `Details` sub-tab (to the left of the `Contributions` sub-tab) disappears. The user must click on `Contributions` and then back on `Details` to display the details again.
2. Closing all Settings windows and attempting to re-open (i.e., <kbd>⌘</kbd> + <kbd>,</kbd>) results in an error: `Unable to open 'Default Settings': Cannot read property 'length' of null.`.

data.title: Go to Symbol should position text cursor on name of target
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.7.0-insider (0706b425537d8cfe2766eac00662ecf988c7ed7f, 2016-10-28T13:00:19.188Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.3|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.6|
|regex|chrmarti|0.0.6|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.0.7|
|ghlink|dt|0.0.4|
|gitlens|eamodio|0.5.5|
|tslint|eg2|0.5.39|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.4.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.1.0|
|diff|rafaelmaiolla|0.0.1|
|kustovscode|seanmcbreen|0.0.1|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.2.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to Symbol that's a class or a class member (possibly others)
2. The text cursor is positioned on the first modifier before the name

This breaks the flow of keyboard navigation for actions like Find All References, Rename Symbol, etc., because the user now has to navigate the cursor to the symbol's name first.

data.title: Detect dead extension host
data.body:
Today when an extension does something ala `while(true);` it won't directly kill the main side (separate process ftw) but it will have bad impact on each and every call we make from the main side to extension host that we have not guarded against this (basically everywhere). 

We should send a regular heartbeat from the extension host to the main side and inform the user when the extension host appears to have gone dark.

data.title: CompletionItem decorator
data.body:
_From @TheColorRed on October 25, 2016 15:46_

Is there a way to add a decorator to a CompletionItem?

I would like to add a color like the way CSS shows the color of the item. Is this possible? If so how can I do it?


_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-extension-vscode#40_

data.body: Add an API method to retrieve only the "visible" text of the document in the editor, something like editor.GetVisibleRange() would be sufficient.

data.title: Can't expand object in debugger variable list
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Stop at any breakpoint, debugging javascript
2. Cannot expand any objects in watch/global list but can watch each variable individually http://i.imgur.com/bLtgZoR.jpg Arrays can be expanded just fine

data.title: "Failed to execute git" with git version 2.10.2
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Archlinux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Update git to version **2.10.2**
2. Run vscode and try to use it 

Git sidebar element loads forever, background git tasks produce a red error box above the code window with "Failed to execute git"

I am able to use git in zsh or other apps so git itself shouldnt be a problem.

Full log:

```
[5479:1031/115947:INFO:CONSOLE(5)] "[uncaught exception]: [object Object]", source: file:///opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/bootstrap/index.js (5)
[5479:1031/115947:INFO:CONSOLE(31)] "Uncaught [object Object]", source: file:////opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (31)
[5479:1031/115947:INFO:CONSOLE(125)] "Failed to execute git", source: file:////opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (125)
[5479:1031/115947:INFO:CONSOLE(31)] "WARNING: Promise with no error callback:6", source: file:////opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (31)
[5479:1031/115947:INFO:CONSOLE(31)] "[object Object]", source: file:////opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (31)
[5479:1031/115947:INFO:CONSOLE(121)] "%c[Extension Host]", source: file:////opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (121)
[5479:1031/115952:INFO:CONSOLE(121)] "%c[Extension Host]", source: file:////opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (121)
[5479:1031/115957:INFO:CONSOLE(93)] "Failed to execute git", source: file:////opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js (93)
```

data.title: Incorrect highlighting when { } are used inside YAML literal style
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Having issues with the highlighting of some AWS CloudFormation YAML templates which have some jsons fragments in YAML literal. Seems the `{ }` may be tripping over the highlighting. Note how on the screenshot the highlighting stops working after the `Bla:` block. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79742/19851554/83ff2db2-9f56-11e6-9459-582146d56bfd.png)

data.title: Open editor window from terminal output
data.body: Would be nice if appropriate editor can be opened based on output from integrated terminal. Possibly on specific position if line:column is specified

data.title: Can't enable extensions after disabling them, without reload
data.body:
When I disable all extensions, I can't seem to _undo_ that action and enable them all. I am forced to reload the window and do it then.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19850924/86f1ad7e-9f5b-11e6-9095-70681d5288bd.png)

Enablement/disablement should merely be a bit flip and the respective actions should be enabled/disabled based on the value of that bit, not whether extensions are active or otherwise.

data.title: Allow to open folder from any opened file in Code
data.body:
Let's say I am editing blah.html on visual studio code.
Later I realize I have to do some changes on blah.css, which is in the same folder as blah.html.

I want to open the explorer tab (not Windows Explorer) on Visual Studio Code, right click on blah.html and click on "Open Folder Here".

Doing this should make the folder where blah.html is stored available on Visual Studio Code, just as if I clicked on "File / Open Folder ..."

Sorry if you could not understand me earlier. Please inform me if I still wasn't able to fully express myself.

data.title: Failure when try to publish an extension for 'Productivity'
data.body:
* have an extension that uses the `productivity` category
* you get the error below


```
Error: Failed Request: Bad Request(400) - The category 'Productivity' is not available in language 'en-us'.
```

data.title: Ctrl+c,s kills folding for according function
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:43:46.054Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-45-generic
- Extensions: LaurentTreguier.vscode-simple-icons-0.2.0, MattiasPernhult.vscode-todo-0.8.0, PKief.material-icon-theme-1.1.3, PeterJausovec.vscode-docker-0.0.7, Zignd.html-css-class-completion-1.0.3, donjayamanne.githistory-0.1.0, emallin.phpunit-1.0.0, felixfbecker.php-intellisense-0.0.11, florianloch.text-transform-0.0.2, formulahendry.auto-close-tag-0.3.4, formulahendry.auto-rename-tag-0.0.7, linyang95.php-symbols-0.1.2, lukehoban.Go-0.6.47, ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1, wcwhitehead.bootstrap-3-snippets-0.0.7

Just noticed this in GO by now

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a go file and move into any function
2. select something
3. Press Ctrl and hold it
4. Press c then s, both while pressing ctrl
5. release ctrl

=> folding for any foldable code within this function is dead.

You can Ctrl+Tab twice (go to another file and come back) to get it back.

data.title: Stop changing selection in explorer when autoReveal = false
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start VSCode via "code --disable-extensions"
2. Set "explorer.autoReveal": false in settings.json

Not sure when this happened or if its specific to my installation (normally I use the default), but if I disable the auto reveal it still jumps to the files in the explorer.

![autoreveal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7542/19848668/567bbc22-9f4f-11e6-9744-89dc17f1abeb.gif)

data.title: Error when I run an automation task using the terminal cmd.exe
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: abusaidm.html-snippets-0.0.18, akamud.vscode-caniuse-0.5.3, alefragnani.project-manager-0.12.0, alexdima.copy-relative-path-0.0.1, andreaskian.vscode-select-line-0.0.3, bogdan-sinitsa.theme-dark-monokai-0.3.0, christian-kohler.path-intellisense-1.1.0, cmstead.jsrefactor-0.5.3, donjayamanne.bower-0.0.3, donjayamanne.jquerysnippets-0.0.1, donjayamanne.listFiles-0.0.3, HookyQR.beautify-0.5.3, jakelucas.code-select-until-0.6.0, lukasz-wronski.ftp-sync-0.3.1, ms-vscode.cpptools-0.9.2, qinjia.view-in-browser-0.0.3, robertohuertasm.vscode-icons-3.0.7, Shan.code-settings-sync-2.3.3, Tyriar.lorem-ipsum-1.0.0, wcwhitehead.bootstrap-3-snippets-0.0.7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. When an automation task is executed using the terminal.

2. For example less to css compiling, in this case I'm using less-watch-compiler (npm package https://github.com/jonycheung/deadsimple-less-watch-compiler):

{[Error: Command failed: C: \ WINDOWS \ system32 \ cmd.exe / s / c "lessc -x less / bootstrap.less> css / bootstrap.css"
The process can not access the file Because it is being used by another process.
]
  Killed: false,
  code: 1,
  signal: null,
  cmd: 'C: \\ WINDOWS \\ system32 \\ cmd.exe / s / c "lessc -x less / bootstrap.less> css / bootstrap.css"'}

If it works and compiles, but not because it tells me that error. I've tried other npm package and always tells me error.

![sin titulo-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2887985/19847063/fe893c0c-9f11-11e6-897d-ca7eaa10fa17.jpg)

data.title: Feature request : supress warning and error messages
data.body:
I think it would be helpful if for some users if they don't want __info__ and __error__ messages popping up all the time.

I'm having this problem while working in a restricted environment at office.

![warning msg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10159531/19846781/27d79620-9f68-11e6-9d80-222bda40d56d.png)

Options like this would be helpful:

``` js
 'editor.supressWarningMessages' : true
```

data.title: Korean translation for terminal.integated.shell.windows removes slashes from path names
data.body:
```js
    // 터미널이 Windows에서 사용하는 셸의 경로입니다. Windows와 함께 제공되는 셸을 사용하는 경우(cmd, PowerShell 또는 Ubuntu의 Bash) 64비트 버전을 사용하려면 C:WindowsSystem32보다 C:Windowssysnative가 더 좋습니다.
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "cmd.exe",
```

"C:WindowsSystem32보다" should be "C:\Windows\System32보다"
"C:Windowssysnative보다" should be "C:\Windows\sysnative보다"

data.title: Feature Request: Org mode
data.body: Org mode is a structured document format for notetaking, authoring and documentation. It's key feature is the notes' collapsible tree structure à la workflowy
